Properties.Description: Multiplier on the pitch of the engine audio while idle. The default value for this property depends on the audio clip name and may not be shown accurately in the editor.

Description.Value: Multiplier on the pitch of the engine audio while driving.
Multiplier on the pitch of the engine audio while driving. The default value for this property depends on the audio clip name and may not be shown accurately in the editor.

Properties.Description: Determines the vehicle type, specifically the movement physics, of this vehicle.
References a physics profile asset Allows for increased control over vehicle settings in bulk.
Disables the wheel object from turning when steering by setting the default value of @Num_Steering_Tires to 0. Replaced by the @WheelConfigurations property.
Total number of tires that should turn when steering. Replaced by the @WheelConfigurations property.
Set a wheel object as a steering tire, which will visibly turn when steering. Replaced by the @WheelConfigurations property.
Whether or not this vehicle defines a Clip.prefab. New vehicles should usually set this to false and use the client prefab for both client and server.
Orthogonal camera size for economy icons.
When generating images, the image name will contain the value of this string instead of this asset's file name.
GUID or legacy ID of another vehicle, which this vehicle should share skins with.
Rarity of this vehicle. Used to color text shown in menus.
Player character should use a handlebar idle animation.
Player character should use a bicycling animation.
Player character should use a reclined idle animation.
First-person camera movement is locked while driving.
Tires should have traction in snowy positions.
Tires should easily roll. For example, most planes will want to use this property.
Indicates that this vehicle does not spawn with a battery.
Multiplier for the battery charge for newly-spawned vehicles.
The rate at which battery charge decreases per second.
The rate at which battery charge increases per second.
How this vehicle's battery should behave when a player is driving it.
How this vehicle's battery should behave with no players.
How this vehicle's battery should behave when the headlights are on.
How this vehicle's battery should behave when the siren is on.
Battery item given to the player when a specific battery hasn't been manually installed yet.
The rate at which fuel decreases per second.
Audio clip to play after entering the driver's seat.
Audio clip to play when using the horn.
Audio clip to play when using the horn.
This vehicle's maximum velocity to aim for while accelerating in reverse, in m/s. Usually will be negative.
This vehicle's maximum velocity to aim for while accelerating forward, in m/s.
Steering angle range at target maximum speed (for the current forward/backward direction). Alternative for @Steer_Max that doesn't multiply by 0.75.
This vehicle's maximum velocity (in m/s) to aim for while accelerating forward. This value ends up getting multiplied by 0.75.
Multiplier for @Steering_Angle_Max used to determine the steering angle range at zero speed.
Steering angle range at zero speed.
A torque value that's added to or subtracted from the wheel motor torque in CrawlerTrack mode.
For a wheel in CrawlerTrack mode, the wheel collider's sideways friction stiffness is multiplied by this value while a steering input is applied.
Multiplier for crawler track steering torque and sideways friction multiplier while driving at maximum speed.
How quickly wheels can turn to meet player input, measured in degrees per second.
If greater than zero, torque is applied on the forward axis according to steering input for bikes and motorcycles.
Whether or not leaning force is multiplied by normalized speed to the power of @Steering_LeaningForce_SpeedExponent.
Leaning force is multiplied by normalized speed to the power of this value if @Steering_LeaningForce_ScaleWithSpeed is enabled.
The amount of braking force to apply. This value is 4 times the breaking torque for each wheel.
The amount of upwards lift force to apply on planes.
Minimum possible fuel to spawn with.
Maximum possible fuel to spawn with.
Total fuel capacity.
Minimum possible health to spawn with.
Maximum possible health to spawn with.
Total health value.
Effect to play when this vehicle is destroyed.
Whether or not the explosion caused by this vehicle being destroyed will deal damage to nearby entities and kill any passengers.
Whether or not the materials of this vehicle's model will be tinted black when it's destroyed.
Optionally specifies which materials should be darkened after an explosion.
A multiplier on the force applied when this vehicle explodes. Should scale with your vehicle's mass.
Minimum amount of force applied to this vehicle when it explodes.
Maximum amount of force applied to this vehicle when it explodes.
Distance away from this vehicle to teleport when exiting.
Distance of the third-person camera from the player when inside this vehicle.
The extra vertical offset (in meters) from @Cam_Passenger_Offset for the driver's first-person camera.
The vertical offset (in meters) for any passenger's and driver's first-person cameras.
Multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) when calculating roadkill damage, the result of which is multiplied by the @Bumper_PlayerDamage property (or the corresponding entity's property).
After multiplying this vehicle's speed (in m/s) by @Bumper_Multiplier, if the value is less than this value, no roadkill damage is applied.

Roadkill damage multiplier for players, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier. This value is the damage done when this vehicle is traveling at 1 m/s with a @Bumper_Multiplier of 1.

Roadkill damage multiplier for zombies, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier. This value is the damage done when this vehicle is traveling at 1 m/s with a @Bumper_Multiplier of 1.

Roadkill damage multiplier for animals, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier. This value is the damage done when this vehicle is traveling at 1 m/s with a @Bumper_Multiplier of 1.

Roadkill damage multiplier for objects, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier. This value is the damage done when this vehicle is traveling at 1 m/s with a @Bumper_Multiplier of 1.

Roadkill damage multiplier for resources, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier. This value is the damage done when this vehicle is traveling at 1 m/s with a @Bumper_Multiplier of 1.
Roadkill damage multiplier for damage done to this vehicle when it hits another entity, which is multiplied by this vehicle's speed (in m/s) and @Bumper_Multiplier.
Damage multiplier for passengers and the driver from explosions.
Maximum distance (in m) this vehicle can move horizontally in a second without being rubber-banded.
Maximum distance (in m) this vehicle can move forward in a single tick without being rubber-banded. Vehicles are simulated at 12.5 ticks per second.
Maximum distance (in m) this vehicle can move backwards in a single tick without being rubber-banded. Vehicles are simulated at 12.5 ticks per second.

A multiplier for the maximum distance between the client's reported position and the server's expected position of a gunshot hit from a turret on this vehicle. This value is multiplied by 64 to calculate the threshold.
The number of seats designated as turrets.
The zero-based index of the seat to mount turret #(Self.KeyGroups[0]) to.
The gun asset to use for turret #(Self.KeyGroups[0]).
Maximum allowed rotation of the turret through the azimuth, in degrees. If this is set to 360, it can rotate rightward forever.
Minimum allowed rotation of turret #(Self.KeyGroups[0]) through the azimuth, in degrees. If this is set to -360, it can rotate leftward forever.
Minimum allowed rotation of the turret through the elevation, in degrees.
Maximum allowed rotation of the turret through the elevation, in degrees.
Normally, the player's camera is positioned at the "Aim" GameObject. Including this flag will disable this feature.
Indicates that this vehicle can only be damaged by weapons that have the @(SDG.Unturned.ItemWeaponAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Invulnerable) flag.
This vehicle cannot be damaged by explosions.
This vehicle cannot be damaged by animals, zombie melee attacks, or boulders thrown by mega zombies.
This vehicle cannot be damaged by collisions.
This vehicle's tires cannot be damaged.
Whether or not this vehicle can be repaired by seated players.
Multiplier on the damage that barricades placed on this vehicle receive when damaged by explosions.
Sensitivity on steering while airborne.
The angle to turn when moving slowly in planes.
The angle to turn when moving quickly in planes.
The angle to turn when moving quickly in planes.

Indicates that this vehicle should use the stamina boosting feature found in bicycles, where the value of this property is a multiplier for the maximum vehicle speed applied when not boosting. Usually this would be less than 1.
Indicates that this vehicle doesn't use fuel or a battery. Usually used with @Stamina_Boost.
Indicates that this vehicle doesn't use fuel and relies on battery power instead.

Indicates that all barricades can be placed on this vehicle, even if they have @(SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Allow_Placement_On_Vehicle) set to false. Set @Buildable_Placement_Rule to @(SDG.Unturned.EVehicleBuildablePlacementRule, Assembly-CSharp::AlwaysAllow) instead.
Indicates which barricades are allowed to be placed on this vehicle.
Whether or not capsule colliders will be attached to the "Seat" GameObject in order to prevent players from clipping into the ground.
Whether or not this vehicle can be locked by a player.
Whether or not this vehicle's battery can be removed by a player.
Number of columns of inventory space in this vehicle's trunk.
Number of rows of inventory space in this vehicle's trunk.
Spawn table ID to use to drop scrap items when this vehicle explodes.
Minimum amount of item drops to spawn from @Drops_Table_ID when this vehicle explodes.
Maximum amount of item drops to spawn from @Drops_Table_ID when this vehicle explodes.
ID of the item that acts as the tire for this vehicle, meaning it can be added to and removed from the wheels.
Whether or not to override this vehicle's center of mass using the @Center_Of_Mass property.
Overrides this vehicle's center of mass.
Multiplier for the force applied when using a Carjack on this vehicle. Should scale with vehicle mass.
Multiplier for the engine force of planes.
Overrides the mass (in kilograms) of wheels.
The offset (in meters) of the train car above the track.
The offset (in meters) between the wheels of the train car.
The distance (in meters) between each train car.
Disable hash verification checks, allowing for mismatched files.
Each section's material's "_PaintColor" property is set to the paint color. This vehicle is not paintable unless this property is defined with at least one section.
Whether or not players can paint this vehicle using vehicle paint tools.
List of materials which offset their UVs in sync with wheels rolling.

Values.Description: An air vehicle with vertical lift.
A vehicle that floats on the water.
A vehicle that is snapped to a track/road placed in the editor.
Battery charge will deplete over time.
Battery charge will replenish over time.

Properties.Description: Scene hierarchy path to a Renderer component relative to the vehicle's root transform.
Zero-based index in the Renderer's material list.
Whether or not all materials should be painted instead of just @MaterialIndex.

Values.Description: Vehicle does not override placement. This means that barricades can be attached unless the barricade sets @(SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Allow_Placement_On_Vehicle) to false (ex. beds and sentry guns are often set to false).
Vehicle allows any barricade to be placed on it, regardless of the barricade's @(SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Allow_Placement_On_Vehicle) setting.
Vehicle prevents any barricade form being placed on it.

Properties.Description: Scene hierarchy path to a Renderer component relative to the vehicle's root transform.
Zero-based index in the Renderer's material list.
Forward vector applied to the UV offset as the vehicle moves.
How far to travel to offset UV by 1 track. See docs for more information.
List of wheels which are averaged to calculate how fast crawler track is moving.

BundleAssets.Description: The prefab of the vehicle loaded on clients and sometimes servers.
The prefab of the vehicle loaded on the dedicated server. Usually new vehicles should only include a @Vehicle prefab.
Audio clip to play after entering the driver's seat.
